texts.text: The next morning, we meet in the middle side square, go see the people who assign work, and apologize.
At first, the nice old man gets mad at us.
But right after, he sighs and asks if we're going to school.
He says he was worried for a second that I'd dropped out after just one day, but then he laughs heartily and sends us off on our way.
Since meeting Yonagi, I've realized many things.
I thought that all lowsiders were looking to drag everyone down while trying to get to the middle side themselves, but I realized there are nice people who don't see life that way.
Rather, there's a curious sense of unity that comes from being looked down upon by the middle and topsiders.
And I realized that there are so many things that I haven't seen yet.
Once we arrive at school, Yonagi takes me straight to the library.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We don't have class today?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No way. We don't get those lectures every day. Professor Asuma only comes around once a week.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: On all the other days, we lowsider students can study whatever we want.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We're going to the library, got it?! You made us spend all day in the workshop yesterday.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I know.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hardly anyone comes here, you know?
Yonagi leads me deeper and deeper into the library.
We can access the terminals with all the digitized lessons by the entrance, but there are also rows and rows of paper books stacked on the bookshelves in the back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wow...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What do you wanna read? Those over there are Japanese novels, and these are English ones. There's history books, science books, cookery books, andâ€”

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Are there any books for doctors?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Doctors? Why?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I just want to read some. I wanna know more about medical stuff.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Medical, huh? Okay, I think there's some over here.
The bookshelf Yonagi guides me to has everything from introductory first aid guides to super specialized books.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Is there... something that has a list of illnesses?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm, maybe this?
I open the book she hands me.
It's a book that lists a different condition and its symptoms on each page.
I can read the letters, but there are a lot of words I don't understand.
Maybe these are words people used on the surface?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think I could use this, but it's kind of difficult to read.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why not borrow it and give it a good read at home?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Borrow it? I can take it with me?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Just two at a time.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's amazing.
Yonagi takes several novels, and I grab a few books that look like they might have information about Mommy's condition.
We sit at a circular desk with four chairs surrounding it.
Yonagi and I place our books on it and sit across from each other.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You really love novels, huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You bet!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Always have?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, I love stories! Reading them AND making them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Making stories is amazing.
Yonagi nods and smiles at me.
All of a sudden, she falls silent and stares at me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Do you wanna hear?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: My story!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, sure.
She beams at me, her whole face blossoming like a flower.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's about a super cool lady!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Go on.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: She's a beautiful love guru!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ooh.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: And she's super cute!
The more she talks, the brighter her eyes sparkle.
Then, she scans the area carefully before turning back to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hey, give me your hand.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What for?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Just do it!
Filled with confusion and apprehension, I reach out to Yonagi.
She takes it in hers.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Now close your eyes.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Ta-daaah!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm Sumomo! Sumomo Momonouchi!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm the peachy Sumomo Momonouchi!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So? Am I cute? Am I?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Am I super chic?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Say something!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wh-What?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What do you think?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: H-Huh? Can I talk in there?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I mean, you made that place, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? You can't talk in it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know. Yesterday I could only watch.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's try it out! It'd be super fun if we could talk in there!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Y-Yeah.

texts.name: Sumomo
texts.text: Yahoo!
I want to respond to her.
But the words don't come out.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh? Yahoo! Hellooo? Kaitooo?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You can't talk?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I really tried.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hmm, that's too bad. If you could talk in there, I was thinking of having you act out roles for me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh well, never mind. She was cute, wasn't she?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?
She puffs her cheeks out and pouts at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm talking about the super chic love guru Sumomo Momonouchi! Who else?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, yeah... Mhm, she was.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Was she cute?
I nod.
Yonagi smiles triumphantly.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Since I named her Sumomo, I made her hair a little pink. Like a peach!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Like a peach?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yep!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, what are those anyway?
Her eyes bulge out in surprise at the question.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What! You don't know what a peach is?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, n-no...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wait right there!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Here, I think you should read this first.
She hands me a thick book.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: E-Enchee...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Encyclopedia. It tells you about all of the food, creatures, and buildings people had on the surface.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The topsider and midsider students study easier stuff than this, so if you just read this one book you'll know everything you need to know.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Read this first, and it'll be way easier to read stuff from the surface. All of the paper books around here are from when people were on the surface.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks, I'll give it a go.
I look over the encyclopedia's cover.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I can only take two books, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, only us downsiders, though. I hear the others can take more.
Then I rememberâ€”
Hah! You don't know?! Guess you don't go to school, that's why you're so stupid!
You downsiders are all stupid.
I remember Shachi.
All the bullying, all the mean words.
Then images of the broken car flash through my head.
It brings it all back, as painful and sad as it was in the moment.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: K-Kaito?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's wrong?
Only when I see the worry in Yonagi's expression do I realize that there are tears rolling down my face.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, it's nothing. Sorry.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, so the students here all study about the surface like this?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll read this. There's a lot I need to learn.
I pick up the encyclopedia and a book on surface medical conditions.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll take these.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sure!
Just before noon, we head to the middle square.
Since we skipped work yesterday, we want to make up for it today.
Other people might have needed to work more because we weren't there.
It's only right that we do a little more today to make it easier on them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mister, I wanna work double to make up for yesterday.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Me too!

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Hmm... Guess I'll take you up on that.
He assigns me and Yonagi to clean the West Common Area and weed the North Common Area.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: That's two day's worth. Finish all that and you'll be good from now on, okay?
Yonagi and I answer with a nod, stuff ourselves with tortillas, then hurry to the West Common Area.
I take care not to stand in front of Yonagi while she's eating her tortillas.
While we're cleaning up, Shachi and other students walk by after finishing their classes.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Hey, thief.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Don't bother coming to school. What do you even think you're doing there?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Aren't you supposed to be working?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm not a thief. I just picked up something that was thrown away.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Yeah, that's what all thieves say.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Don't come back to school.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Same goes for you, albino freak. You're always at the library, right? Stay away.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll keep going there every day. I like studying, and the library is free for everyone to use.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You downsiders don't need to study for the work you do!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: We're the only ones who have to study!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Why study when you're a bunch of brainless idiots?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi's not stupid.
When I speak out, Shachi turns back to me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And I'm not stupid either. I'm going to read books and learn more about the surface.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You should be working double for your stupid useless mom!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No!
I snap back in such a loud tone that I can barely believe it myself.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She's exempt from labor because of her condition. Yonagi taught me that, and she taught me that I can go to school!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm gonna read as many books as I can.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And I'll become a researcher someday!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: A researcher? A downsider?
I nod emphatically.
After a marked moment of silence, Shachi's laugh booms in our ears. Immediately, the other midsider kids behind of him also start laughing loudly.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You're hilarious! No way a dirty downsider can become a researcher!
He sneers at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: He'll become one! He's super smart.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Professor Asuma always says that anyone who's good enough can become a researcher.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: And how's a stinky downsider that attends one class per day becoming a researcher? Are you seriously this stupid?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There's a lot more ways to study.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: There's not! You clowns! A downsider can't become a researcher!
Shachi leaves after that, still laughing with his little posse in tow.
I notice the android he always has with him following closely behind.
It's so strange.
Today, Shachi wasn't as scary as he usually is.
And I'm not sad about him making fun of me anymore.
I'll do my best to become a researcher. Nothing anyone says matter.
No one will keep me from studying and learning how to cure Mommy.
I turn to Yonagi with a smile.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's get back to work. We've still gotta make up for yesterday.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, let's do it.
Just as we're finishing up the two days' worth of work together, the bell signaling the time for ration distribution rings.
We hurry to put the weeding tools back and get in line to receive our food.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Mhm.
When it's our turn, the nice old man gives us more rations than usual.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: You worked double today, remember?
Yonagi and I exchange glances.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But we skipped work yesterday...

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: And did you get any food yesterday?
Both of us shake our heads.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Let me tell you kids one thing. We live in a world where those who put in the work get rewarded for it.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: The moment we forget that, this town is done for. You know why?
Both of us stare up at him curiously.
He leans down, brings his face closer, and lowers his voice to almost a whisper.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Because all the idiots living up there have forgotten already.
And then, his wrinkly face breaks into a jolly smile.
Yonagi and I look at each other again and grin.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We got a whole bunch of food!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Can I come eat at your house?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sure. I think Mommy will like that too.
Yonagi said she lives alone.
So it'll be nicer if all three of us eat together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So, um, how did your parents, well... die and stuff?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You wanna know?
I think for a moment.
And then I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wanna know because... because I'm your friend.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think that's why.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm, thanks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm really happy to hear that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But can we take it slow? I'm sure I'll tell you everything when I'm ready.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But if you...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, that's okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I really mean it when I say I'm happy that you want to get to know me better.
I nod in response.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thank you. Really.
Yonagi takes hold of my hand as she thanks me.
I squeeze her hand back and nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're back.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ah, welcome home!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm here too!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, Yonagi! Welcome back!
Yonagi's face lights up when she realizes Mom's happy to see her as well.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm! It's nice to be back!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We got a lot of rations today.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah! We got them for working double today!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: That's wonderful! You must have worked so hard. Good job!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Come on, let's eat! Then we can read Kaito's Adventure!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll warm it up.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let me help!
We all eat dinner together.
Mom uses only her right hand to slowly eat the meal I set on top of her lap.
After that, I take "Kaito's Adventure" from the shelf.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mind if I start from the beginning, Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's okay. I'll turn the pages.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mhm, thank you.
I open the book to the first page for her.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Once upon a time, there was a deep, deep chasm. Inside the chasm was a city, and for the people inside the city, the sky looked like a round, far away thing.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: The people in this city knew neither the sea nor the open sky. All of them were born and lived their entire lives inside the deep chasm.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: But there was one lone person among them who had seen the sea.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: That person was Kaito's father. His little son loved hearing the stories his father told him about the big blue sea and sky.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: The boy grew up dreaming of seeing the sea and the sky his father told him about for himself someday.
As Mommy keeps reading in her usual gentle tone, Yonagi's eyes sparkle.
Up until now, the reading time has just been Mommy and me.
But Yonagi's with us today.
That small change makes me happy.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: See you tomorrow, Mommy! And you, Kaito!
Yonagi says, with a big smile on her face.
Mommy's eyes widen for a second, but she smiles happily one moment after.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes. Good night, dear.
Like yesterday, I watch Yonagi walk off until she disappears into the fields.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: She went home?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm...
The thought of Yonagi going back to an empty house makes me a little sad.
It would be nice if we could all live together.
But...
This house would be too small for all of us.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: She called me Mommy just now, heheh. She's such a ray of sunshine, isn't she?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: If I study a lot and the teachers at school see I'm smart, I could become a researcher even if I'm a downsider.
Mommy looks down at me attentively.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll study lots and become a researcher someday. Then we can live in the middle side.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you think you can wait until that happens?
Smiling fondly, Mommy nods at me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Of course. I can't wait to see you achieve it.
After Yonagi's left and Mommy's gone to sleep, I lie awake, unable to sleep.
So many things happened today, and they're all still so vivid in my head.
I get up slowly, careful not to wake Mommy.
Then I go to my bag and fish the heavy encyclopedia out of it.
On the cover are a bunch of men and a lot of things I don't recognize.
I open the cover.
Each page is dedicated to one topic. I feel like I can learn a lot by reading this.
I start reading from the very first page.
There are lots of words I don't know.
Each word has a detailed definition with examples.
I keep turning the pages, my mind greedily absorbing everything like a sponge.
It's been almost a week since I started going to school.
Over the last few days, I finished reading the encyclopedia I borrowed from the library.
After that, I was able to go through the medical books a little more easily.
The more I learn, the more books I can read.
I'm happy about that, but I was not happy to discover that the book didn't have any condition similar to Mommy's in it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wanna go to the workshop again? Don't you wanna build something else?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, right... Hmm...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We can go to the library. I'm having fun reading right now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's really fun, learning all this new stuff little by little.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And I got to show the working car to Mommy thanks to you.
The experience Yonagi gave her was pretty much as though she were up there watching it with us.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm, yeah. I'm glad. Let's go to the library then.
When we get there, I fish the encyclopedia out of my bag.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hey, so how do I return this?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?
She stares at the thick encyclopedia for a moment.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You read it already? All of it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No way!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh, I did...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I couldn't sleep, so I just kept reading...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa, you read all this so fast. You're like a scholar or something.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What are you reading next? Another medical book?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm, I wanna read something more detailed this time.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're so smart!
While Yonagi chooses a novel, I pick up more medical books.
I also pick up one about celestial bodies, which was a topic that interested me in the encyclopedia.
It has a photo of a huge comet on the cover.
When I come back, Yonagi looks at the cover curiously.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's that comet?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Halley's Comet, I think.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Halley's Comet?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? You don't know about it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was in the encyclopedia you showed me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right. I read it before, but I guess I forgot.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You read it and forgot?
Yonagi stares at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's normal, isn't it? Right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know, I...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I never really forget anything.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Gimme me the encyclopedia.
A little nervous, I hand it over to her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?
Yonagi flips through the pages and stops at a seemingly random one.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's a morning glory?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's the common name for a flower of the family Convolvulaceae. It blooms in summer. It was first recognized as a medicinal flower in Japan during the Nara era.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No way.
Her eyes bulge out as she reads over the entry.
She keeps flipping through the pages.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wh-What's a bear?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was on a page with other brown animals. They're carnivoran mammals of the family Ursidae, and there are eight species. They have good sense of smell.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: A-A camera!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: A specialized tool for taking pictures. It uses a telephoto lens to capture images of distant objects. If you use a wide-angle lens, you can take pictures that are wider than a human's field of view.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wha... You really do remember... So...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What's an artificial pigeon?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Telecommunication devices modeled after pigeons. They grew old and died just like normal animals. They were made by a Japanese person named Izana Hazuki.
I recall that page in my mind.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: From 2046 to 2061, they became uncontrollable, and all communications devices on the surface were rendered useless.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Isn't that like.... super weird?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You really remember it all?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I only just read it...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: People normally forget!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I mean, what were the years again? Like, 2045 and 2061 or whatever! Is there any reason to remember the exact years?
Yonagi checks the encyclopedia, still perplexed.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That's not true. The page about Halley's Comet also had the year 2061.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?
She flips through pages rapidly and stops somewhere in the middle of the thick book.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa, you hit the nail...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hit the what?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: As in, you're right.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, okay.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It appears every seventy-six years. Though there are only pictures of it up to 2137.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: D'you think that's because everyone was already underground by the time it came around next?
I nod.
I figured that's what happened too.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: 2061, huh? Sounds like that was one busy year.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're amazing, Kaito! You're a genius! I'm certain you'll become a researcher!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I actually think you have to! You NEED to be one!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? You think so?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yep! If you keep learning stuff, I'm sure you can come up with something incredible someday!
I look over the medical book I brought as I listen to Yonagi's cheerful support.
The cover reads "The Link between Brain and Body."

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I'll do what I can.
The encyclopedia taught me that there are many things I want to learn.
Of course, I want to learn about stars and comets, but I also want to learn more about plants, and the oceans are fascinating too.
These two books aren't enough.
I want to read so much more.
After finishing school, I head to the middle side with Yonagi.
We check the assignments for afternoon work then head to the park to eat our lunch.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're together again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah! Maybe they're putting us together on purpose. It's dandy by me, though! Let's get it done in a jiffy!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
We spend the afternoon focused on cleaning.
We got sent to the West Common Area today.
The monitor's displaying images of the surface again.
It looks like a rainforest.
I see a colorful bird perched on a branch, turning its little head around.
I learned about the rainforest and birds from the encyclopedia.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?
I squint at the screen.
It's usually quiet in the common areas.
But now...
I can hear a sound that's not coming from the monitor.
As I focus on it, I realize it's coming closer.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Shh.
I bring a finger to my lips and gesture for her to be quiet.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm?
Keeping my attention on the faint noise, I push through the tall grass at the back of the common area.
And when we make it to the imposing concrete wall surrounding the middle side, we find a gaping hole in it with bare earth peeking through.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's that?
I crouch and stare into the hole.
Beyond the soil and roots, I see some faint streaks of light.
I prick my ears again.
There's something in there.
I can hear something inside.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What was that just now?
Yonagi murmurs, standing close behind me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Should we go and see?
I nod and take a step into the hole.
The sensation of the soft soil under my feet reminds me of walking on the lower side.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm coming too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay.
After I'm inside, I take Yonagi's hand and help her through after me.
Then we set off walking, holding hands in the dark.
Our footsteps are absorbed by the earthy walls of the narrow passage.
Our eyes gradually become used to the dimness as we move toward the faint light in the distance.
The passage seems to go on forever, but eventually we come to the end and find the source of the light.
And all around it, a blanket of blue.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's the sky.
As I try to take a step forward towards the light, Yonagi holds my hand tight and pulls me back.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What?
She shakes her head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There's no ozone lens here.
I look up at the sky.
The lens protect us from the strong rays of the sun.
Unlike in the underground city, there's nothing to shield us from the direct sunlight here.
We keep ourselves hidden in the little passage leading up to the bright clearing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah.
I catch sight of something small stirring in the grass ahead of us.
I squint my eyes, trying to see better.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's a bird.... I think it's injured.
I run up to it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No!
I hear Yonagi cry out behind me.
A few steps in, the light envelops me.
And the first thing that goes through my mind is...
How warm it feels.
The bird's little chest is heaving, and its eyes are closed.
Small stripes of red blood run down its ruffled torso.
It's the same color as human blood.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito? Are you okay?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think the bird is hurt.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm talking about you! You're under the sunlight!
I look at the palm of my hand.
The ozone lens is what protects us from the ultra violet rays.
Mommy taught me that.
But nothing seems different about the parts of my skin that are being touched by the light.
I take a look up.
The sun shining down on me is so bright that I can't keep my eyes open.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think I'm okay for now.
I turn back to Yonagi.
She has an anxious look on her face.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You're... fine?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I think so.
I give her a thumbs up and then turn my attention back to the bird laying at my feet.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe it fell all the way here from the surface?
I reach out and timidly touch its round, feathered head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...It's bleeding.
I turn back to Yonagi standing next to me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Think we could help it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's take it to my house. Maybe we can stop the bleeding.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Okay.
I open my bag and pull out a cloth I use to wipe my hands.
I gently lift the bird and wrap the cloth around it.
Soon enough, a little red spot forms on the cloth.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go.
We go back to the common area.
There's no one around.
The tools we were using to clean with are still where we left them.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Can you go pick up our rations?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Sure. I'll come to your house after I've got them.
I nod, then set off at a dash for the lower side.
I run through the fields, and the first thing I do after slamming the front door open is place the bird on the table.
When I unwrap the cloth, I see that the bleeding seems to have stopped.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, I'm so glad.
I take our box of medicine and bandages from the shelf.
It's a little first aid kit that all houses are provided with.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito? What's wrong? Did you hurt yourself?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's not for me.
I grab the little disinfectant spray bottle.
Wait, is disinfectant for humans safe to use on birds?
I have no idea.
I didn't read anything about it in the medical book or the encyclopedia.
The bird lets out a few sad chirps.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: What's that?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Give me a minute...
After thinking for a moment, I decide against using it.
Instead, I just grab a clean cloth, dip it in water, and wipe the area around the wound.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito!
Yonagi comes through the still open door, out of breath and carrying the rations.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ah, welcome back, dear.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hello, Mommy! Kaito, how's the bird?!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Bird?
Yonagi comes closer and peers down from beside me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How is it doing?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The bleeding's stopped.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
Yonagi takes a closer look at the bird.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Is it its leg? Is that where it's hurt?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Its leg?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, doesn't it look like it's trying to stand?
On closer inspection, I see that the bird's right leg is twitching uselessly.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, you're right.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What do we do? Can we make a splint?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe with a toothpick? Do you have any?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Its legs are so thin.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, don't wrap it up too tight.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's kinda difficult...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe you should cut the bandage a little thinner?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Kaito? Can I take a look at it?
Both Yonagi and I turn back to Mommy.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I'll show you how to bind it up.
After exchanging a glance with Yonagi, I gently pick up the cloth with the bird atop it and carry it over to the window.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: This leg, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Can you bring me the scissors?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Coming.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Okay, cut the bandage a little thinner. Yes, that's it, pull it with your finger just like that.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Looks like a thread, doesn't it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Make it long. Now, make a big, open knot on its leg.
I do a big, loose knot just like she says.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Where's the toothpick?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Here.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Okay, now slide that inside the knot.
I take the toothpick from Yonagi and slowly push it inside the knot.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, just like that. Now slowly pull the knot tight.
I carefully pull the little thread of bandage, tightening the knot.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It worked!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It sure did. Well done.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Think it'll get better now?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: We should make our little friend a comfy place to sleep.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: To sleep?
Mommy nods, takes a look out the window, then leans in close to us.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Can you go and fetch some corn leaves and the tassels?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I'll teach you how to make a little nest for our friend.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Amazing!
When we weave the corn leaves together just like Mommy taught us, we produce something like a green bowl.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We put these inside of it, right?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes, dear.
Yonagi carefully spreads the corn tassels on the bottom of the leaf bowl.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I did it!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Let's put our little friend in here so it can sleep.
Mom gently picks up the bird with her right hand.
Then she places it in the soft, leafy bowl.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I hope it helps the poor little thing.
As she murmurs to herself, Mommy puts the bowl on the window sill.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: This animal...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's called a bird.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: A bird... Where was it?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We found a hole in the middle side wall. The bird was inside of it.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe it came from the surface?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: There are no birds anywhere in the middle or the top side.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: From the surface...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The hole goes all the way up to the surface.
For a moment, Mommy is stunned into silence.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Are you okay?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, we just tried to help the bird.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: But what about the sunlight?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Nothing happened.
Yonagi takes a look at her own arms.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wonder why...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe we were under the lens without realizing it.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: That's probably it...
Yonagi's staring intently at the small bird on the window ledge.
Both Mommy and I follow her gaze.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...I hope it gets better.
The bird is lying on the small makeshift bed with its eyes closed, not stirring at all.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm... Huh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh...
I wake up to someone knocking on the door.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Who could it be?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaaaitooo!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Come ooouuut! I know you're there!
I look toward the window and see Mommy already awake and sitting up in bed.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Heheh, think it may be Yonagi?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaaaitooo! Rise and shine!
I look at the door, then back at Mommy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...I think it's her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Good morning! Did I wake you up?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So that's what you were trying to do, huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Saw right through me, eh?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know when the last time I woke up this early was.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How's the bird?!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It's awake.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, it is! I'm so glad!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Do you think it can fly yet?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't know. Its wings don't look hurt or anything.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I wonder what our little friend would like for breakfast.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I did some reading on it yesterday. We can grind up some dried corn and feed that to it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's make some now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yep!
I take a pinch of the corn feed we ground, put some on the palm on my hand, and bring it closer to the bird.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Go on, eat up.
Still lying on the tassels, the bird looks at my hand and cocks its head.
After a moment, it begins pecking at the feed on the palm of my hand.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's eating!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thank goodness!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah! It's adorable!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You think it'll be able to fly again soon?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, I just know it will!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's kind of tickling my hand.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let me feed it! Please!
I pull my hand back, then Yonagi timidly puts hers forward. In seconds, the bird is eating from her hand instead.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahah, it really tickles!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Okay, we're off to school.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Take care, you two!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll come by again tonight, Mommy.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I'll be waiting, dear.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: The bird looked way better today!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I'm happy about that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I hope it gets all better soon.
Yonagi and I walk side by side to the classroom.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We have Professor Asuma's lesson today, right?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, I think he'll continue where he left off last week with that whole paraglucose thing.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I'm sure you're all familiar with the lens that covers the whole city.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Its technical name is an 'ozone lens.'

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But it is not made of ozone, as the name may imply. Ozone is an unstable molecule that consists of three oxygen atoms.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It had a somewhat absorbent effect, and it was one of the components making up the stratosphere.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This ozone layer absorbs ultraviolet rays. It protected humans from the most dangerous elements of the energy that radiates from the sun.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Since the lens we use today fulfills the same role, in time people came to call it the ozone lens.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: In reality, the lens up there is made from reinforced plastic plates coated with a thin film of titanium oxide.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: And this lens protects us from the sun's UV rays, just like the natural ozone layer did once upon a time.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: If my memory serves me right, I ended the last class on the topic of how paraglucose mutated human genes.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It wasn't an overnight change, but one that accumulated over generations of genetic variations passed from parent to child.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: As for what the change itself was: Human skin became extremely vulnerable to UV rays.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Skin exposed to those strong UV rays would develop malignant melanoma, which rapidly produced cancer cells that began to metastasize throughout the whole body within just forty-eight hours.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wha...
Yonagi and the other students have the same reaction.
The buzz of the classroom dies down into a bunch of muffled whispers.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Before the discovery of paraglucose, melanoma was known to be a type of cancer with a high risk of becoming metastatic.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Normally, such metastasis would take months.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But due to the altered genes caused by the paraglucose, it became a deadly disease that advanced and killed the patients in a matter of hours.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Though each person is a different story, most people now run the risk of becoming paralyzed simply from brief exposure to direct sunlight.
That word sticks with me: melanoma.
My eyes are glued to the projection of the corpse on the wall.
Yonagi knew all this.
That's why she tried to stop me.
But...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Why were we okay back then?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't know...
I stare down at the back of my hands, then at my palms as I turn them over.
I don't notice anything abnormal about them.
And then I realize something.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The medical book I read didn't mention anything about this.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't think there were books about it yet. All the paper books in the library are stuff from the surface.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, of course...
So I'll have to study the new things that were discovered after we started living underground on my own.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It takes only a few minutes for the body to go into shock and become unresponsive. Once a person loses consciousness and is unable to move away from the UV rays, what follows is a prompt passing within a few hours.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Although unwittingly, that is the way humans have evolved thanks to paraglucose. It is our new life, and thus...
The professor scans the classroom.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We have no choice but to stay underground.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: There was a fifteen-year transition period in which all human settlements were relocated underground.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: During that time, many methods to at least keep a presence on the surface were investigated.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: But due to unforeseen accidents presenting themselves in all scenarios, it was decided that moving all of the remaining population underground was the only way to ensure the survival of the species.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This is what Japan looked like during its most prosperous era before humanity was forced below ground.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa, it's so pretty.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah...

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Of course, we haven't completely given up on the prospect of returning to the surface.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Life underground is harsh, as I'm sure all will agreeâ€”no matter which side you're from.
My gaze wanders towards the front seats where the topsider students sit.
I notice they all have smiles playing around their lips.
I wondered if there was a common thread that transcended the layers. I wondered.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Various migration strategies are being formulated and tested in the research institutes of the middle side.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: For example, the creation of personal protective wear, or building an artificial stratosphere using ozone lenses. And that's not all...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's the sea!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: One of the more unique ideas proposes creating a simulation of life on the surface and moving the whole population there, even if only in mind.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: In the mind?

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The idea proposes creating a surface city in the virtual space and transferring the minds of all the underground residents into it.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This approach would also allow those not physically healthy enough for life on the surface to experience it the same as everyone else.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The exertion on their bodies would be no different from merely sleeping.
I gulped.
We could help Mommy move like this. It could work!
Not in the middle side, or the topside either! All the way to the surface!
I can't take my eyes off the beautiful vistas projected behind the professor.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: In the meantime, researchers could proceed with devoting all their time to finding a way to establish a true city on the surface.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The population could await the achievement of this goal, all while getting acclimated to life on the surface and remembering how to coexist with nature.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Furthermore, in such a deep state of sleep, the body's metabolism slows down. This would lead to savings in both water and food.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: This would be a temporary measure that would allow many to experience life on the surface, and would smooth out the transition to true surface life when the time came.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: What's more, it would help us save on scarce resources. These three aspects make it a very attractive proposition.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Surely it would be the rational option to spend resources on such research before starting a real migration to the surface. What do you all think?
I nod vehemently.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's incredible!

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The actual costs of building the infrastructure for such a system are lower than other options as well. However, it is true that this is the most challenging method of them all.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Human minds are rather complex, to say the least. It is not a simple endeavor to create an environment that can fool the brain into believing it's real.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Why, then, did I just spend all this time explaining the most difficult option of all?
A smile touches his lips for a moment.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Because it is, in fact, the subject of my own research.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: I truly believe that this avenue has potential enough to give my life in service of doing the necessary research.
With that, the professor closes his computer.
Still dazed, I simply stare at him unblinkingly.
I want to participate in that research too.
No...
I will participate in it someday.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Professor Asuma is amazing!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Y-Yeah? I guess?
After the class is over, we head over to the middle side square.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You saw his research! If it's successful, even people that can't move will be able to experience the surface!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, right. You mean Mommy!
I nod in response.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yes! It's amazing! I can't believe it... I want to help with that research!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That sounds great! Mhm!
I can't help but smile as I look on ahead.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah. I never even imagined we could move her mind somewhere else. That way she could move about while I find a way to heal her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: She could do whatever she wanted, even if it's just in a dream.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: And if you don't know you're dreaming, then I suppose it would basically be the same as real life, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hey, what do you think?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: M-Me?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The surface is way bigger than here! If researchers can make a virtual version, it would be super huge!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wonder if they have machines that can do that here underground. What do you think?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Well, I don't really know, but I guess they should?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wonder how the professor would solve that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I wonder how big that virtual space he talked about would even be.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Would people be able to talk with each other in there?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wait, maybe if...
When I raise my head, I notice Yonagi staring straight at me.
She looks a little upset.
Did I do something wrong?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's wrong?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Could we talk about something else?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If you care so much, why didn't you go and ask the professor yourself?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Like after class was over.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I can't just do that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: The topsiders sit in the front, and then there's the midsiders.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't think he cares about who's asking the questions.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I actually think he'd be really happy to see a kid who wants to know about his research.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I don't think I can.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Aw, but you totally want to!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's fine. It's more fun to try and figure things out on my own.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's just gonna end up like last time, though! You know, the whole thing about making the car work with the gears and all that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Reinventing the wheel...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, that!
Maybe Yonagi has a point.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, recess is over.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We'd better go.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wanna go check up on Mr. Birdie, so let's get work out of the way as quick as we can.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah, same.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We're back!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Hello, Mommy!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Welcome, dearies.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: How's Mr. Birdie?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: He's been eyeing up the place all day. It's really funny, watching him look around at everything.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wanna see!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's really funny how he turns his head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's so cute! I wonder what he's looking at.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It moves kind of like a machine. The little cries sound like a motor running.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You think so? I don't think I've heard him make a squeak.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: He does sometimes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Really?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Keep quiet for a moment and we'll see...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: There you go!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ahahah! It does sound like a machine!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Right?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: How was school today? Did you two have fun?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah! We had our class with Professor Asuma!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Professor Asuma?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: He's the school's principal, and he works in the middle side research institute.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, I see.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy, his research is amazing!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: He hasn't shut up about it all day.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He's researching a system so that everyone here can experience what life is like on the surface!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: For everyone! Imagine that! Ah, err, maybe I should explain...
I explain everything I heard in the class today to Mommy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So his solution would let people live a life on the surface without having to worry about the UV rays hurting them!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's amazing! I can't believe you can just leave your body and transport your mind somewhere else!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Would that be like... a dream? Or...
Mommy turns to Yonagi.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Like that vision Yonagi showed us the other day?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Aah, maybe?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Maybe. We can't really move inside the visions Yonagi makes, but I think the professor wants to make it so everyone can move inside that virtual space.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: That way it doesn't matter if someone's sickâ€”everyone could be there.
I look up at Mommy.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We could live together on the surface!
The beginning of a sweet smile starts to spread across her face.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mm? Is everything okay, dear?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah, well... I don't know if it's okay for me to ask.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I just, um... was wondering what kind of illness you have...
Mommy and I look at each other.
Then she slowly turns back to Yonagi.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I haven't been diagnosed by a doctor, so we don't really know.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: One day I just couldn't move my toes.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: From there, it slowly spread up through my body.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: This hand is the only part I can move now.
She says, raising her right hand for Yonagi.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? But can't you move the fingers on your left hand?
After a second, a shade of sadness covers her eyes and she shakes her head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Since when?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: This morning.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh no...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You don't know why it's happening?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I see... So that's why you're reading medical books.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: He is?
Feeling a little shy, I nod.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But there's nothing like it in any of the books.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thank you, sweetie. It warms my heart to know how much you care about me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No! I can't save you if I can't figure it out.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I won't stop until I find a solution. That's why I'm going to school.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I promise I'll save you.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'm gonna do it, I swear.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mhm. I'll be waiting for you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm really sorry.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh? For what?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: For making Mommy talk about her illness. Maybe I should have asked you when we were alone.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's fine. I don't think she cares about that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm... It'd be nice if they got better. Mommy and Mr. Birdie, I mean.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.
Feeling a little sad, I look up at the round sky above us.
The perfectly circular black sky is covered in a mantle of stars.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think the bird will want to go to the surface.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think they're supposed to fly free in the sky. I don't think it likes being stuck in that small room.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe, yeah. When it's better, let's take it back where we found it.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.
I can see the reflection of the ozone lens between us and the sky.
And the wire frame that separates the plates and holds them in place.
I remember that mysterious place where we found the bird.
I remember thinking that there couldn't have been an ozone lens between me and the sky there.
But nothing happened to me.
Or to Yonagi.
The image of that metastasized melanoma-ridden corpse from earlier flashes in my mind.
Why did nothing happen to us?
If what the professor said was true, we shouldn't be standing here now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No, nevermind. Can I come by tomorrow morning?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sure you can.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Are you sure I'm not interrupting your time together?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're not! I haven't seen Mommy so happy in a long time. I think it's because you started coming.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Thanks.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll come tomorrow at the same time, okay?
Yonagi hangs her head and begins fidgeting with her fingers again.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Um...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Well, do you think Mommy would let me take her picture?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?
I think for a moment then remember the camera she showed me during my first day at school.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Oh, you mean with the polaroid camera?
She looks a little surprised upon hearing that word.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Polaroid?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Cameras that process the photos on the spot like that are called polaroid cameras.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It was in the encyclopedia.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, wow!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think she'd like that. Bring it tomorrow.
Yonagi smiles and bobs her head energetically.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah! I'll take a picture of Mr. Birdie too!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I'll have breakfast ready for you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I can't wait! See you tomorrow! Sleep well!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm, good night.
Yonagi happily skips into the cornfields on her way back home.
I wake up to find that Mommy and the bird are already up.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Uh...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Good morning, dear.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: You're up early.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Well, Mr. Birdie here is an early bird indeed.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm... *Yawn*
I yawn and stretch out my sleepy limbs.
When I turn my bleary eyes back to Mommy, I see the bird resting on her right hand.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Whoa!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It's eating the feed you two made yesterday.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ooh!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hahah, it's so cute when it eats.
I watch as the bird pecks at the feed, still sitting atop Mommy's right hand.
Just then, I catch a glimmer of something out of the corner of my eye.
It falls down onto the towel spread across Mommy's lap, leaving a little wet stain.
I raise my face and look up at her.
It's only then that I realize what it wasâ€”a tear.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy? What's wrong?
She slowly shakes her head.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: It's nothing, dear, really...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Um...
All of a sudden, a flapping sound reaches my ears.
It can only mean one thing.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah!
The bird flies through the air, circling around.
The beating of its wings echoes loudly in the small room.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's so cool! Did you see that?!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: ...Kaito.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy, the bird!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You're an incredible boy, Kaito. You're the kindest, smartest boy. I feel so blessed... for having an angel like you in my life.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Remember this. You can accomplish anything you set your mind to.
Her quiet voice overlaps with the sound of the bird's wings.
After a moment, the bird comes down and settles by the window.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah, it must be Yonagi.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes. Let her in, dear.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Good morning!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hey! The bird flew just now!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah!
Yonagi and I rush to Mommy's bedside.
The bird twists its neck to look at us, then immediately faces forward again.
It does that a few times, as though eyeing up something that's piqued its interest.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh? Mommy?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah!
The bird hops around, turning its back on us.
The next instant, it flies out a gap in the window.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Look! It can fly! It's flying out!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Heheh. Kaito, go follow our little friend.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah! Let's go, Yonagi!
I rush out the front door.
The sound of his footsteps grows distant.
I turn and see Mommy looking out the window.
Kaito looked so happy.
He almost never smiles like that.
It was the same smile I felt like I wanted to keep on his face ever since the first time I saw it.
But something feels off. Even though I love seeing him smile...
I can't turn away from Mommy right now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mommy?
I try to sound happy, but my voice comes out more like a whisper.
But there's nothing else in the quiet room, so Mommy hears and turns to me.
She looks at me with that same kind smile she always has for me.
I realize that it's the same way she looks at Kaito.
The thought makes me happy.
I'm so happy to see her smile.
And even more so to have that smile aimed at me.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yonagi.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes?
I approach slowly and sit by her bedside.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Would it be okay if I asked you to look after Kaito for me?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: You know how much of a crybaby he is. If he had a strong girl like you to watch after him, it would give me so much peace of mind.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Maybe it's a little too much to ask?
I shake my head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: No, I will! I promise!
Even though I know I shouldn't say it, I just can't help myself.
But I don't think I'm making a mistake. I'm doing what feels right.
I want to do everything I can to see him happy.
I know I can do that.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thank you, love. You don't know how much of a relief it is to hear that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Um, actually, I... Well...

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes?
I lean a little closer to her and whisper into her ear.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mommy, I... I love him.
All of my courage comes out in a murmur.
I feel like my face is on fire as I finally say it.
Mommy's eyes widen in surprise, but then her expression settles back into the same kind smile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You can trust me! I'm gonna keep my promise, no matter what!
She raises her eyebrows for a moment, then breaks into a little chuckle.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, Kaito is such a lucky boy.
Not really knowing what to say, I just nod along.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Thank you so much, Yonagi. I am so very glad to have met you.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Me too!
I can hear Kaito's voice from the other side of the window. He sounds like he's having fun.
He's shouting something as he chases after the bird.
His enthusiasm is so contagious that I can't help but laugh.
I see Kaito running ahead, his face the very image of joy.
Mommy does the same.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Oh, one more thing! Can I ask you something?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Yes?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I kind of wanted to take a picture of you.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: A picture?
I nod enthusiastically.
I pull out my polaroid camera, and her eyes are immediately drawn to it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Um, with this camera here.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I wanna take pictures of people I love very much, so I never forget about them.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So I want to take your picture.
She stares at me for a moment.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Heheh, I'm a little bit shy, but sure.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Am I okay like this?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Ah, but would you be a dear and wipe my face? If I take a picture like this, Kaito will know I was crying.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Right!
I grab a kitchen cloth and present it to her.
But Mommy remains still, her smile growing a little sad.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mommy?

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: I'm sorry, sweetie. Could you wipe my face for me? Just around my cheeks is fine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Of course I can!
I lean forward and wipe her cheeks gently.
Her skin looks so white from up close.
And it's... not soft at all.
In that moment, I realize just how strong of a woman Kaito's mom is.
I'm certain that up to this day...
She's been keeping up that smile to reassure us. I understand now how much of an effort it must take for her to keep smiling like that.
I hope I can become as strong as her someday.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...You're very pretty, Mommy.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Oh, thank you.
I also realize that I should tell her the truth.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mommy. I want to tell you the truth.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Mm?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: ...I won't be able to be with Kaito forever.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I don't think I'll be able to stay like I am for that long.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But I promise I will make him happy.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll make lots of happy memories with him. That way he'll be able to keep smiling forever.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: You don't need to worry! It'll be fine!
I say those words as much for myself as for her, really.
Mommy looks down at me for a moment, then a happy smile parts her lips.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: In that case, I can rest easy.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes! You don't need to worry about a thing!
Mommy gives me a small nod.
I slowly take a step back.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm gonna take the picture!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Okay, you better get my good side!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes!
I position the camera and press the shutter.
Bathed in the light coming through the window, she has that beautiful smile on her face.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Now, I think you should go see Kaito doesn't get himself into trouble.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yes! I'll take a picture of Mr. Birdie too!
I head to the front door, then turn back to Mommy.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll go get him so we can all have breakfast before school! I'll be right back, Mommy!
She sees me off with a smile and a nod.
I nod back at her.
I somehow know that this conversation with Mommy will be something I'll never forget.
A memory that will stay with me, always.
I feel I just received a baton of sorts from her.
That's why...
I feel like I should go to Kaito now.
With a smile on my face, just like her.
No matter what's waiting for us.
I think that's what Mommy wants.
I'm sure Kaito will value our time together too.
But above all, I just want to be with him.
I smile, she nods again, and I turn to chase after Kaito's voice.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito!

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: ...Thank you, sweetie.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Forgive me, Kaito.

texts.name: Mom
texts.text: Be good, Kaito, Yonagi...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaaaiiitooo!
Enraptured, I watch the bird fly over the cornfields, until I hear Yonagi call out to me.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What took you so long?! Look! It's over there!
I shout, pointing at the bird as it flies about the middle side.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Whoa! It's flying so high!
I run after it.
The bird is flying with so much more ease than back in the house.
When Yonagi starts running after us, the bird changes course and flies towards her.
It's like it wants to show itself off to her.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: So cool!
The bird perches itself at the tip of a corn stalk.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Picture time! Let me take a picture, Mr. Birdie!
Yonagi says, breathing heavily as she pulls out her camera.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Hurry! It's gonna fly away.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I know!
Yonagi slowly approaches with the camera, then presses the shutter.
The bird stares curiously at the small black camera for a moment.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I took it!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let me see! How does it look?
The form of the white bird slowly emerges on the glossy white paper.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It can go higher? Wow!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah!
Yonagi points at the bird.
It flaps its wings again and takes flight higher than ever before.
Laughing happily, we chase after the bird.
It soars higher and higher.
Soon the bird overlaps with the rays of sunlight seeping through the ozone lens.
When the light hits at that angle, its silhouette becomes darker.
I squint at it.
The bird and its spread wings are enveloped by the dazzling light.
I stare at the small shadow as it flies above.
...It's getting bigger.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huh?
Wait, no.
The shadow isn't getting bigger; it's coming towards us...
Until it disappears from sight and drops to the ground with a weak thud.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why?!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito!
I run as fast as my legs can carry me.
The thump of my shoes hitting the ground drums in my ears.
From behind, I hear Yonagi running after me.
I break away from the small path and push my way through the stalks of corn.
The thick leaves slice at my hands and cheeks as I run by.
The stinging pain gets sharper, but I keep running.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Why?! No, no, no!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Huff! Huff! Huff!
Once we get to it, I understand at first glance.
The bird isn't there anymore, not really.
The little thing that rose to the sky just a moment ago...
It's gone now.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito, I...
It's happening again.
Like with the broken car.
It's just like back then.
I'm losing something important, right in front of my eyes.
There's nothing here anymore.
I feel my throat tighten.
The tears spill from my already wet eyes and patter onto the cold ground.
Just like back then, I don't think I can stop crying.
The tears just keep on coming.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I think... that he probably wanted to show us his last flight.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That's what I think.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's no one's fault, Kaito. You know that...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Y-Yeah... *Sob*

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's take him home. Then we can go and bury him back where we found him.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah...
I gently pick up the bird and cradle it with both hands.
Its little eyes are closed.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...It doesn't look like he was in pain.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
I quietly open the door to the house.
Once we enter, the click it makes as it closes echoes through the room.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mommy...
My voice comes out as a murmur as I try to fight the tears back.
I look at her bed by the window.
Her head is hanging down, and she seems...
A chill runs through my bones, and my hairs stand on end.
I don't want to see.
I don't want to know.
I don't want to get closer.
But I'm unable to stop walking towards her.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No... No... Why...
My hands quiver around the bird's corpse.
The only thing that keeps me from dropping it is Yonagi's hand on mine.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yonagi... Mommy, she...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm...
I wonder why my knees don't buckle.
I don't even know if I'm crying anymore.
It feels like my body's a thousand miles away, and I can't even think.
I simply blink again and again.
But no matter how many times I do it, I open my eyes to the same scene.
The image of Mommy leaning forward, like a withering flower that can no longer stay upright in the vase.
I realize that there's no life in there anymore.
There's still bird feed in her right palm.
And then I realize.
That's when she stopped being able to move that arm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: *Sob* I'm sorry, Mommy, I... I know I have to be strong for him...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But... I just...
Yonagi's quiet sobs bring me back.
And I cry with her.
I place the dead bird on Mommy's lap.
Somehow, I feel like the moment that bird fell was when she breathed for the last time.
From the view of that bird flying high, the city must have looked like one single, uninterrupted space connected to the sky.
Low side, middle side, top side...
It couldn't have seen any of the lines we draw to separate people.
I'm sure that bird is the one who took Mommy to the sky in the end.
Through the ozone lens...
It took her life up to that blue endless sky.
I bawl inconsolably.
I cry out in sadness.
Both Yonagi and I cry for so long we lose track of time.
At some point, we started holding hands.
I don't know who started it.
I don't know how long we've been connected like this.
It's just what comes naturally to us.
Before me...
Before us, the sky and the sea spread out endlessly.
All at once, I know.
Both of us are seeing the same thing.
Our hearts are connected, and we're seeing it together.
I see a single bird flying across the sky.
Towards the place where the blue sea and the blue sky meet at the horizon.
A briny breeze surges from below.
The bird flies freely, swaying gently from side to side as it glides on.
With tears still pouring down our faces, we watch it go.
But before long, the little bird becomes nothing but a dot that then disappears behind the clouds.
A simple hole in the bare earth wall of the low side.
That's all we lowsiders get for a grave.
Graves we might call them, but they're not much more than small holes in the dirt that we then cover the bodies of the deceased. And now, Mommy's in one of those.
We were exempt from work yesterday.
Some of the adults came with a stretcher made out of wood and cloth and carried Mommy out.
The nice old man that assigns us work was there too.
We both followed as they took Mommy away.
The encyclopedia I read listed several types of funerals they did back on the surface.
People long ago burned the dead out of fear they would come back to life, or buried them in weird positions, or left stones above their graves to keep them from getting up.
Maybe having a huge sky over their heads made their imaginations run wild.
Down here, we know it's just a corpse. It won't come back to life.
So we wrap them in a cloth, and then bury them deep inside a hole in the clay walls surrounding this side.
There's a lot of soil for that here in the low side.
The adults bury Mommy's body deep down in the earth.
Yonagi and I look down together at the small mound of soil covering her.
She holds my hand, and I hold hers back as we stand there.
As I'm leaving the spot where they buried her, I notice that one of the holes in the clay looks surprisingly neat and well maintained.
I don't see anyone around here.
But the way this hole has been dug out seems kind of strange.
What could it be?
I stop and stare at the dark hole.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Long ago...
Suddenly, a familiar voice makes me turn around.
I see the nice old man standing behind me.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: I hear there used to be a topsider who worked hard to help the people down here in the low side.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Stories of a doctor who did his best to help the sick, like your mom. People said he was like a god that came down and lifted up the poor lowsiders.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: God...
He nods.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: But that's an old story by now. There's no topsiders like that anymore.
No.
There is no god.
A god would have helped Mommy.
So god doesn't exist.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Just a little rumor I heard in the markets a few decades ago.

texts.name: Chief
texts.text: Let's get you back, kid.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.
And just like that, the funeral was over.
No time to stand there and say goodbye.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm.
But we already said our goodbye to Mommy.
The two of us saw her flying off over the endless sky.
Between the sea and the sky, like in the last chapter of Kaito's adventure. She loved that story.
The empty bed looks out of place now.
There's the small potted plant by the window, and the little nest we made for the bird.
It almost seems like a lie that they were still here just yesterday.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We should bury him too.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mhm, yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We should take him back there, right?
I nod at her. Then I go fetch the nest, the potted plant, and a small shovel on our way out.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go.
It feels like it's been weeks since I was last here, and it's still as bright as it was back then.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We'll be okay, right?
A little anxious, Yonagi holds my hand.
I nod back and take a step into the light.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I think it's okay.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
We take a step forward together into the light and walk to the center of the little field of flower.
I crouch down and start digging a small hole.
It doesn't need to be as big as the hole that was dug for Mommy.
It doesn't even take me five minutes to finish digging deep enough.
A small hole, just big enough to bury these memories.
I place the corn leaf bowl the three of us made together into the hole, then lay the bird inside it.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Maybe we should've given Mr. Birdie a real name.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Not just Mr. Birdie... It would've been nice if we'd thought up a proper name for him.
Tears streak down her cheek.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Goodbye.
I use the same shovel to fill in the hole again.
Once the bird is covered, I take the plant out of the pot and replant it in the mound of fresh soil.
Yonagi stares down at the plant.
I glance at her profile then get to my feet.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's come visit sometimes.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We can remember them both here.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We have to keep living, so we can remember them.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah.
We pass through the small passage and come out into the middle side again.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What are you two doing?
As we come out to the square, we find Shachi there.
It looks like he's on his way home from school.
Izumo's behind him as usual.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Come on. Where did you two pop out from? Aren't you supposed to be working?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We weren't doing anything.

texts.name: Shachi
