texts.text: Yes you were! We're in the middle side! What the heck are you two worms doing here if you're not working?!
Shachi stomps up to us and shoves me away.
I fall back into the bushes and land on my butt, pushing the shrubs apart and leaving the open hole in the wall in plain sight.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What? What the heck is that? I've never seen that there! Izumo!

texts.name: Izumo
texts.text: It is not in my data banks.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Whoa, you don't know?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito! Are you okay?
Ignoring Shachi, Yonagi helps me up.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Thanks. Yonagi.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What's in there?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Nothing.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Lying thief! You know what's in there!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Get in! You go first!

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito...
Pushed on by Shachi, I enter the passage and head towards the light again.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What the heck is this? Is that... sunlight? This goes up to the surface?

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: What were you doing here?!
As soon as we enter the clearing, Shachi is startled by the bright light.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You were here, right? You were up to something! Why aren't you dead?!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We don't know.
Out of nowhere, he gives me a shove from behind, pushing me into the beams of light.
I stagger but manage not to fall this time.
I simply stare as it bathes in the sun.
Shachi timidly steps into the light too and looks up at the sky.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Nothing happens... It's okay!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: That's the sky, right?! And the damn sun?! Is this wind? Hey! This goes up to the surface, right?!
Shachi turns to me, and I notice his eyes are bloodshot, his expression somewhat frightening.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: You went up there?! You went to the surface?!
I shake my head.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We didn't do that.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: We... just made a grave here. That's all.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: Are you stupid or what?!
He shouts at us, then turns around and jumps onto the ivy growing over the walls of the clearing.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: This is the best! I can't believe it! I can go to the surface, and I'll be okay! Pfft, what was with the whole ozone lens scare?!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: This rocks! I'm number one! I'll be the first! I'll be on the surface before everyone else!

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: I'll be a hero! Everyone will remember me!
Izumo's still hanging back in the passage, simply staring at the scene as it unfolds.
Shrouded in darkness, only her eyes shine a pale blue.
Yonagi and I watch helplessly as Shachi climbs the rocky wall.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: What do we do?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: ...Just leave him.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: But...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He can do whatever he wants. I don't see any reason to put ourselves in danger for his sake.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's not like we can stop him.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: *Huff*! *Huff* Hah! Hahah!
I hold Yonagi's hand tight.
Only then do I notice that she's trembling.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's go.
Izumo glances at us with those pale eyes as we pass by her in the dark passage, then turns back to the light.

texts.name: Shachi
texts.text: I'm number one! Me! I'm the best!
We go back to the middle side and leave the hole in the wall behind.
This time no one sees us.
Yonagi keeps looking back nervously towards the hole.
Before long, we can't even hear Shachi's crazed shouting anymore.
We remain quiet even after we make it to the square.
We simply sit on a bench in a corner, holding hands and staying close together.
I put the shovel and the empty pot by my feet and watch the people walk by.
After a while, people begin to gather in the square.
One after the other, something draws their attention and they start to shout.
After a few moments, everyone in the square is looking up at the ozone lens.
There's someone doing some sort of dance on top of it.
It looks so surreal.
It's Shachi.
He skips about and spins around on top of the lens, spreading his arms out and throwing his head back up to the sky.
People keep gathering and the buzz turns into a horrified commotion.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Wha...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's him... He's dancing? He did it...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He's on the surface.
But then something happens.
Shachi suddenly stops, like a wind-up toy that's run out.
And then, with his hands still raised, Shachi falls flat onto his back atop the lens.
The commotion in the square turns to cries of pure horror.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito!

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Wha... Why?
I've seen death face to face in the last two days.
I can tell that Shachi is not getting up again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Is it melanoma?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I can't see from here...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: But it must be.
I slowly nod, still looking up at the figure seemingly floating above the ozone lens.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: He's... dead.
For a while after that, the whole city is a mess.
It isn't until a few days later that the turmoil starts to dissipate.
I don't think anyone could be calm after looking up to the sky and seeing a corpse.
I heard some adults in big white protective suits were sent to open up the lens and recover the body at some point.
It sounds like they did it during the night, but the people who saw it spread the news around town.
One week goes by, then the next.
Eventually, people in the lower side are able to resume work as usual.
And school finally starts again too.
When Professor Asuma enters the classroom, everyone goes silent.
Everyone's looking at him.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Recently, one of our students passed away.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: The cause of death was organ failure caused by the rapid spread of cancer through his body.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: It's still not known how he managed to get to the surface. That's still under investigation.
Yonagi and I glance at each other.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Some of the more privileged families in the top side have sun windows in their dwellings.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: While they are not normally able to be opened, there is a chance he could have opened it through means that are still unclear.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We must learn from this sad incident. Let us not forget how fragile and precious our lives are.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We must never forget that the only thing separating us from an inhospitable world is the ozone lens. While the sky may seem near, we should stay isolated from it.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: We researchers are working tirelessly to find a solution that will allow for the migration efforts to be fruitful.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: While I understand the yearning to reach for the sky, none of us should aspire to follow his example.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Greed often leads to grief.

texts.name: Asuma
texts.text: Lessons will resume from next week. Until then, let's all try to get things back to normal.
Yonagi and I are assigned to a group of adults today. We're supposed to do maintenance on the middle side walls.
Maybe they're looking for holes in the city walls after what happened.
Both of us have the same thought.
While the others wait for the cement to dry, we separately peel off from the group so as not to draw attention to ourselves.
We meet in front of the hole in the wall.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: That day...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Shachi was acting so weird and scary.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: If anyone else finds this, it could happen again, right?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Let's cover it up.
I nod in response.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: I was thinking the same.
Though I know she's in pain, Yonagi smiles.
We grab stones from nearby and pile them up in the entrance to the passage.
We work slowly but steadily.
As I focus on the task, memories from the last few weeks come to my mind.
Meeting Yonagi.
Learning about her power.
Learning more about the world through books.
Finding that bird from the surface.
And saying goodbye.
When Yonagi came into our lives, Mommy seemed so much happier. Every day felt so fun and warm.
But...
Now we'll never see Mommy again.
It's just the two of us now.
We'll have to keep living in the low side.
Maybe forever. Just piling up the days.
Like these rocks.
One by one, one top of the other.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Ah...
The rocks finally cover the entire hole.
If we just keep moving forward a little each day, maybe we'll reach something.
Perhaps a way to save the people of this city.
A new life that could make Yonagi happier.
I don't know much of anything right now.
But as the days go by, I'm sure we'll find something new. We just need to hold on.
We stand up, looking over the laid down small stones.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's use the cement.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's another wall now.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Yeah.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It means we can't go visit the grave anymore, but this was the right thing to do, wasn't it?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: As long as we remember where it is, we can always break it open. All we'll need is a hammer.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Someday.
Staring at the fresh cement, I smile, a genuine smile that spreads across my whole face.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: When we... When everyone finds a way to stop living like this, let's come here again. Together.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: By that time, people won't be afraid of the sunlight or the sky anymore.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Yeah, let's do that.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: We'll open up the hole again, so we can hear any birdies that have flown in there.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: So, until then...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Let's live. Together.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mhm.
After filling in the hole, we gather all the waste from our work and head to the dump.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito. Can I stay at your house today?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Sure.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Mm?
I turn around to see Yonagi looking down at her feet again.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I was alone before, and you're alone now, so why don't we live together?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Huh?

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's fine if you don't want to.

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: No, I do. I'd like that a lot.
She looks up and smiles at me.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'm so glad! I've been thinking about it, and I really wanna live in the house where Mommy was.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: I'll bring my things over a bit at a time, okay?
I nod, feeling my face break into a smile.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Mm? Kaito?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: What's that?
I notice something behind Yonagi.
Something catches my eye in the mountain of trash from the top side.
Yonagi turns around and follows my gaze.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Ah...
Her usually pristine clothes are dirty and grimy, and the eyes that shone with a pale blue light the last time I saw them look all glassy now.
She looks like a broken toy. Or, as the last few weeks have taught me... a corpse.

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: It's her...

texts.name: Yonagi
texts.text: Did they throw her away?

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: Shachi's android...

texts.name: Kaito
texts.text: It's Izumo.
